partintro.title: Introduction
partintro.para:
This is generated reference documentation for all user-specifiable processing instructions (PIs) in the DocBook XSL stylesheets for FO output.
You add these PIs at particular points in a document to cause specific “exceptions” to formatting/output behavior. To make global changes in formatting/output behavior across an entire document, it’s better to do it by setting an appropriate stylesheet parameter (if there is one).

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets background color for an image

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo background-color PI before or after an image (graphic, inlinegraphic, imagedata, or videodata element) as a sibling to the element, to set a background color for the image.

listitem.para: An HTML color value

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets background color on a table row or table cell

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo bgcolor PI as child of a table row or cell to set a background color for that table row or cell.
This PI works for both CALS and HTML tables.

listitem.para: An HTML color value

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies float behavior for a sidebar

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo float-type PI to specify the float behavior for a sidebar (to cause the sidebar to be displayed as a marginal note).

listitem.para: Specifies that the sidebar should be displayed as a marginal note.

refsect1.title: Related Global Parameters
refsect1.para: sidebar.float.type (parameter), sidebar.float.width (parameter), sidebar.properties (attribute-set), sidebar.title.properties (attribute-set)

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies presentation style for a funcsynopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo funcsynopsis-style PI as a child of a funcsynopsis or anywhere within a funcsynopsis to control the presentation style for output of all funcprototype instances within that funcsynopsis.

listitem.para: Displays funcprototype output in K&R style
Displays funcprototype output in ANSI style

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies presentation style for a glossary

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo glossary-presentation PI as a child of a glossary to control its presentation style.

listitem.para: Displays the glossary as a list
Displays the glossary as blocks

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies presentation style for a glosslist

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo glosslist-presentation PI as a child of a glosslist to control its presentation style.

listitem.para: Displays the glosslist as a list
Displays the glosslist as blocks

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies the glossterm width for a glossary or glosslist

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo glossterm-width PI as a child of a glossary or glosslist to specify the width for output of glossterm instances in the output.

listitem.para: Specifies the glossterm width (including units)

refsect1.title: Related Global Parameters
refsect1.para: glossterm.width, glossterm.separation

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies “keep” behavior for a table, example, figure, equation, procedure, or task

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo keep-together PI as a child of a formal object (table, example, figure, equation, procedure, or task) to specify “keep” behavior (to allow the object to “break” across a page).
The PI also works with informaltable, informalexample, informalfigure and informalequation.

listitem.para: Enables the object to break across a page
Prevents the object from breaking across a page (the default stylesheet behavior)

refsect1.title: Related Global Parameters
refsect1.para: formal.object.properties

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies the label width for a qandaset, itemizedlist, orderedlist or calloutlist

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo label-width PI as a child of a qandaset, itemizedlist, orderedlist, or calloutlist to specify the width of labels.

listitem.para: Specifies the label width (including units)

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies interval for line numbers in verbatims

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo linenumbering.everyNth PI as a child of a “verbatim” element – programlisting, screen, synopsis — to specify the interval at which lines are numbered.

listitem.para: Specifies numbering interval; a number is output before every Nth line

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies separator text for line numbers in verbatims

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo linenumbering.separator PI as a child of a “verbatim” element – programlisting, screen, synopsis — to specify the separator text output between the line numbers and content.

listitem.para: Specifies the text (zero or more characters)

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies width for line numbers in verbatims

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo linenumbering.width PI as a child of a “verbatim” element – programlisting, screen, synopsis — to specify the width set aside for line numbers.

listitem.para: Specifies the width (inluding units)

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies presentation style for a variablelist or segmentedlist

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo list-presentation PI as a child of a variablelist or segmentedlist to control the presentation style for the list (to cause it, for example, to be displayed as a table).

listitem.para: Displays the list as a list
(variablelist only) Displays the list as blocks
(segmentedlist only) Displays the list as a table

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies the width of a horizontal simplelist

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo list-width PI as a child of a simplelist whose class value is horizontal, to specify the width of the simplelist.

listitem.para: Specifies the simplelist width (including units)

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies the orientation for a CALS table row or cell

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo orientation PI as a child of a CALS table row or cell to specify the orientation (rotation) for the row or cell.

listitem.para: Specifies the number of degrees by which the cell or row is rotated

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies if an equation or example goes across full page width

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo pgwide PI as a child of an equation or example to specify that the content should rendered across the full width of the page.

listitem.para: If zero, the content is rendered across the current text flow
If 1 (or any non-zero value), the content is rendered across the full width of the page

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies the width for a CALS table entry or row

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo rotated-width PI as a child of entry or row instance in a CALS table to specify the width of that the entry or row; or use it higher up in table to cause the width to be inherited recursively down.

listitem.para: Specifies the width of a row or cell (including units)

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies the width of a sidebar

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo sidebar-width PI as a child of a sidebar to specify the width of the sidebar.

listitem.para: Specifies the sidebar width (including units)

refsect1.title: Related Global Parameters
refsect1.para: sidebar.float.type parameter, sidebar.float.width parameter, sidebar.properties attribute-set, sidebar.title.properties

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: (obsolete) Sets the starting number on an ordered list

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This PI is obsolete. The intent of it was to provide a means for setting a specific starting number for an ordered list. Instead of this PI, set a value for the override attribute on the first listitem in the list; that will have the same effect as what this PI was intended for.

listitem.para: Specifies the character to use as the starting number; use 0-9, a-z, A-Z, or lowercase or uppercase Roman numerals

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies the width for a CALS table or for revhistory output

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo table-width PI as a child or sibling of a CALS table, or as a child of an informaltable, entrytbl, or revhistory instance (which is rendered as a table in output) to specify the width of the table in output.

listitem.para: Specifies the table width (including units or as a percentage)

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies the term width for a variablelist

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo term-width PI as a child of a variablelist to specify the width for term output.

listitem.para: Specifies the term width (including units)

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies whether a TOC should be generated for a qandaset

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo toc PI as a child of a qandaset to specify whether a table of contents (TOC) is generated for the qandaset.

listitem.para: If zero, no TOC is generated
If 1 (or any non-zero value), a TOC is generated

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide
refsect1.para: Q and A list of questions, Q and A formatting

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specify a need for space (a kind of soft page break)

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A “need” is a request for space on a page. If the requested space is not available, the page breaks and the content that follows the need request appears on the next page. If the requested space is available, then no page break is inserted.

listitem.para: The amount of height needed (including units)
The amount of extra vertical space to add (including units)

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies the height for a CALS table row

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the dbfo row-height PI as a child of a row to specify the height of the row.

listitem.para: Specifies the row height (including units)

refsect1.title: Related Information in DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide
